rules: Rule1: Either the clinical trial requires FDA approval or the manufacturing facility requires FDA approval.

Rule2: If the manufacturing process uses unapproved ingredients, then provided that the company following protocols does not result in the company not violating regulations, the company receives a warning from the FDA.
Rule3: Either the manufacturing process uses unapproved ingredients or the manufacturing process uses incorrect dosages.

Rule4: If the manufacturing process uses incorrect dosages, then provided that the company following protocols does not result in the company not violating regulations, the company receives a warning from the FDA.
Rule5: Either the company maintains proper documentation or the company operates legally.
Rule6: If the company loses records, then the company does not maintain proper documentation.
Rule7: Either the company loses records or the company falsifies data.
Rule8: If the company falsifies data, then the company does not maintain proper documentation.
Rule9: If the facility passes FDA inspection, then the company operates legally.
Rule10: If the equipment meets GMP standards, then the facility passes FDA inspection.
Rule11: If the equipment is calibrated properly, then the equipment meets GMP standards.
Rule12: Either the company has trained staff or the company does not maintain proper documentation.
Rule13: If the manufacturing facility requires FDA approval, then the company operates legally.
Rule14: If the staff fails certification, then the company does not have trained staff.
Rule15: Either the staff fails certification or the staff follows procedures.
Rule16: If the staff receives insufficient training, then the staff does not follow procedures.
Rule17: Either the staff receives insufficient training or the staff ignores protocols.
Rule18: If the staff ignores protocols, then the staff does not follow procedures.
Rule19: If the marketing application requires FDA approval, then the company operates legally.
Rule20: Either the clinical trial has completed phase 3 or if the clinical trial requires FDA approval, then the marketing application requires FDA approval.
Rule21: If the drug batch contains contaminants, then the drug batch fails quality control testing.
Rule22: Either the drug batch contains contaminants or the company operates legally.
Rule23: If the drug batch fails quality control testing, then the drug batch gets recalled.
Rule24: If the company following protocols does not result in the company not violating regulations, then the company does not receive a warning from the FDA.
Rule25: If the company does not operate legally, then the company violates regulations.
facts: Fact1: The equipment is calibrated properly.
Fact3: The clinical trial has not completed phase 3.
Fact4: The drug batch does not get recalled.
